adjective.description: (of sound) deep, clear, and continuing to sound or ring.
(of a room, musical instrument, or hollow body) tending to reinforce or prolong sounds, especially by synchronous vibration.
Relating to or bringing about resonance in a circuit, atom, or other object.
(of a color) enhancing or enriching another color or colors by contrast.

origin: Late 16th century: from French résonnant or Latin resonant- resounding, from the verb resonare, from re- (expressing intensive force) + sonare to sound.
